page.title: 15Interviewing a Farmer
page.content: Mr Proctor farms 135 acres,40 acres of wheat, 30 acres of winter barley, 20 acres of sugar beet, the rest spring barley. His grandmother started with 1 acre and a cow, expanded it and soon had 9 sons to help.45 years ago they kept 3 milk cows, 8 bullocks and 20 pigs but do not keep animals now. He works the farm alone with a bit of casual labour when necessary whereas it used to need his father,2 brothers, 1 full time worker and 6 casual women workers.The reason less labour is needed now is because of mechanisation a change which became necessary when Scunthorpe works expanded and Keadby Power Station was built.Thus workers left for higher wages.He felt that community spirit was less now because people were no longer connected to the land.He has 3 tractors,1 combine.
